Counselling

Includes adult, adolescent and child counselling

Helping you think your way to a safer place

Services

What is counselling?


Most individuals choose counselling for a reason that is specific to their needs.

We all experience a time in our lives when we feel a little low, are worried or distressed. Feelings like these could be because of specific difficulties, such as anxiety or bereavement or perhaps a general sense of feeling 'down' and not sure of the reason why.

Counselling offers the opportunity to explore these genuine concerns in a confidential, non-judgemental setting with someone who is trained to help.
Talking through your issues with someone who is really listening and trying to understand how it is for you, without judging, can make a real difference.

Why Ski Counselling?


I offer counselling to women on a range of issues in regards to their health and overall well-being.

Issues that are covered include: Stress Management, Relationship Issues, Anxiety Post Natal Issues Grief and Bereavement, Self Esteem Building, Time Management, Weight Issues, Other General Counselling.

I provide professional counselling to pre teens and adolescents covering issues such as; VCE mentoring during year 12 studies, Self Esteem, Relationship Issues (Including family and friendship) Anxiety, Stress, Anger, Conflict Resolution, Grief and Bereavement, School Disengagement and any other counselling issues as requested.

Contact

Appointments


Please email me to organise an appointment.

First appointment is free as we get to know each other and discuss what to expect and how I can help you.

If you leave a contact number, I will call you or you can email on the above address.
